page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: Our Domesday area is part of rural West Yorkshire.It includes part of Woolley village on the east and West Bretton village on the north-west.Much of the land is used for farming,and we visited Church Farm at the time of sheep shearing.The only industrial site is Woolley Colliery. The M1 motorway runs through the area from north to south.Bretton Hall,once a country mansion, is now a College of Higher Education.In its grounds is the Yorkshire Sculpture Park and adjacent is Bretton Country Park.We also visited Woolley St.Peter,s church with its tower of five bells, and Woolley Edge Scout Camp.There are reports about three people living in the area today, and also a village gala and a church patronal festival.
